markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Weapon 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Barricade Buster](/Weapons.aspx?ID=330)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Kickback" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=409" />
<trait label="Orc" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=124" />
<trait label="Razing" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=488" />
<trait label="Repeating" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=374" />
<trait label="Volley 20 ft." url="/Traits.aspx?ID=201" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 30 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 9 gp

**Damage** 1d10 B

**Bulk** 3
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Hands** 2

**Range** 40 ft.

**Reload** 0
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Category** Advanced

**Group** [Firearm](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=16)
</row>

**Ammunition** [8-Round Magazine](/Weapons.aspx?ID=349)

</column>

---

Developed by a [half-orc](/Ancestries.aspx?ID=8) inventor from Alkenstar who brought the technology north to battle the Whispering Tyrant alongside the [orc](/Ancestries.aspx?ID=19) hordes of Belkzen, the barricade buster features eight barrels fixed around a central pivot attached to a handle and firing mechanism. A barricade buster fires spheres of metal with extreme velocity and very little accuracy.

<title level="2">Critical Specialization Effects</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 283 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make a Strike with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

[Click here for the full rules on Critical Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=235).

<document level="2" id="weapon-group-16" />
name: Barricade Buster
